SEARCH
Package com.tradingcards.elements.binder

Class BinderView

java.lang.Object
com.tradingcards.elements.binder.BinderView
public class BinderView extends Object
The BinderView class handles user interaction related to binders, such as prompting the user to input a binder name.

    • showMainCardDisplay

      public JPanel showMainCardDisplay(HashMap<String,CardModel> collection, String outgoingCard, String incomingCard, double difference)
      Displays a side-by-side panel of two cards involved in a trade, along with the value difference.
      Parameters:
      collection - the card collection map
      outgoingCard - the name of the card to be traded out
      incomingCard - the name of the card to be added
      difference - the value difference between the cards
      Returns:
      a panel showing the two cards and the difference

    • setBinderType

      public String setBinderType()
      Displays a dialog for the user to select a binder type from a predefined list.

      The method shows a JOptionPane input dialog with the following options:

      • Non-curated Binder
      • Sellable: Pauper Binder
      • Sellable: Rares Binder
      • Sellable: Luxury Binder
      • Collector Binder
      The first item ("Non-curated Binder") is selected by default.

      Returns:
      the selected binder type as a String, or null if the user cancels the dialog or closes it without making a selection.

    • showBinderForm

      public BinderModel showBinderForm()
      Displays a form sequence to create a new BinderModel instance.

      This method prompts the user to enter a binder name and select a binder type. If the user cancels any of the dialogs or returns a special exit code (e.g., "-999"), the method returns null.

      Based on the selected type, it creates an instance of one of the following:

      • NonCuratedBinder
      • PauperBinder
      • RaresBinder
      • LuxuryBinder
      • CollectorBinder
      The display name used in the constructor is a shortened, internal-friendly version of the binder type.

      Returns:
      a new BinderModel instance with the selected name and type, or null if the user cancels any part of the input process or if the type is unrecognized.

    • displayBinders

      public JPanel displayBinders(HashMap<String,BinderModel> binderCollection)
      Displays the list of all binder names in the binder collection.
      Parameters:
      binderCollection - a map containing binder names and their models

    • displayBinderContent

      public JPanel displayBinderContent(HashMap<String,CardModel> binder)
      Displays the contents of a binder, including each card's name. If a card has more than one copy, it is listed multiple times.
      Parameters:
      binder - a map containing card names and their models
